elite:
精英 
the people who have the most wealth and status in a society; the most successful or powerful group of people — usually singular
attorney:
律师，代理人 
one who is legally appointed to transact business on another's behalf
unrequited:
爱情 没有回报的；单方面的；单相思的 
(of love) not returned by the person that you love
inanimate:
无生命的 
not living; not capable of life
propel:
推动 
to push or drive (someone or something) forward or in a particular direction
preeminent:
杰出的 
more important, skillful, or successful than others; better than others
partisan:
盲目支持的，偏袒的，有倾向性的 
strongly supporting one leader, group, or cause over another
monstrous:
极可恶的；令人震惊的 
(of a person or an action) inhumanly or outrageously evil or wrong

令人不悦之物巨大的；特大规模的 
extremely and dauntingly large
hatch:
舱口；舱口盖 
an opening in the deck of a ship or in the floor, wall, or roof of a building

使孵出；孵出 
to come out of an egg; to be born by coming out of an egg
sparse:
稀疏的，稀少的 
present only in small amounts; less than necessary or normal
stray:
迷路；偏离；走失 
to move away aimlessly from a group or from the right course or place intractable adj.难以管束的 
not easily governed, managed, or directed
arbitrary:
随意的；任性的；专断的 
based on random choice or personal whim, rather than any reason or system; (of power or 
a ruling body) unrestrained and autocratic in the use of authority 
8
sullen:
阴郁的，阴沉的 
gray and dark

闷闷不乐的 
used to describe an angry or unhappy person who does not want to talk, smile, etc.
furious:
猛烈的 
very powerful or violent
refute:
反驳 
to prove that (something) is not true 
9
impede:
阻碍 
to make it more difficult for something to happen or more difficult for someone to do something
aura:
气氛 
a special quality or feeling that seems to come from a person, place, or thing
prompt:
立即；迅速的；及时的 
done without delay

敏捷的；迅速的；准时的 
of a person acting without delay; arriving at the right time 人

促使；导致；激起 
to make somebody decide to do something; to cause something to happen

给演员的提词，提示 
a word or words said to an actor, to remind them what to say next when they have forgotten
posterity:
后代 
all future generations of people
notoriety:
臭名昭著 
the condition of being famous or well-known especially for something bad; the state of 
being notorious
tangent:
离题的 
diverging from an original purpose or course

相切的 
having a common tangent line at a point
protrude:
突出，伸出 
to stick out
bipedal:
两足动物的 
(of an animal) using only two legs for walking
dilemma:
进退两难的窘境，困境 
a situation which makes problems, often one in which you have to make a very difficult 
choice between things of equal importance
mundane:
世俗的；平凡的，单调的 
of this earthly world rather than a heavenly or spiritual one; not interesting or exciting
stout:
肥胖的；肥壮的 
(of a person) rather fat
offset:
抵消；弥补；补偿 
to use one cost, payment or situation in order to cancel or reduce the effect of another
encode:
把 译成密码，编码 
to put (a message) into the form of a code so that it can kept secret 
10
clot:
凝结凝块 
to become thick and partly solid
resonant:
共鸣的 
strongly affecting someone especially with a particular quality
prophet:
预言者 
a person who states that something will happen in the future
languid:
无精打采的，倦怠的 
showing or having very little strength, energy, or activity
forbearance:
忍耐 
the quality of someone who is patient and able to deal with a difficult person or situation 
without becoming angry
contemptuous:
轻蔑的 
feeling or showing deep hatred or disapproval
legume:
豆科作物 
a leguminous plant (member of the pea family), especially one grown as a crop
overrule:
否决，驳回 
to decide that (something or someone) is wrong; to rule against (something or someone)
solace:
安慰；慰藉；给以安慰的人或事物 
a feeling of emotional comfort when you are sad or disappointed; a person or thing that 
makes you feel better or happier when you are sad or disappointed
irritate:
激怒 
to make (someone) impatient, angry, or annoyed
onlooker:
旁观者 
a person who watches an activity or event without being involved in it
obsession:
着迷；困扰；强迫观念 
compulsive thought, fixation; craziness about a certain issue; excessive preoccupation 
11
poise:
沉着自信；稳重；自若 
a calm and confident manner with control of your feelings or behaviour

优雅的举止；仪态 
the ability to move or stand in a graceful way with good control of your body

保持某种姿势；抓紧；使稳定 
to be or hold something steady in a particular position, especially above something else
animosity:
敌意 
a strong feeling of dislike or hatred
vascular:
血管的；脉管的；维管的 
relating to, affecting, or consisting of a vessel or vessels, especially those which carry blood
mischief:
淘气；恶作剧；顽皮 
bad behaviour (especially of children) that is annoying but does not cause any serious 
damage or harm

恶意；使坏的念头 
the wish or tendency to behave or play in a way that causes trouble

伤害；毁损 
harm or injury that is done to somebody or to their reputation
insolent:
傲慢的，无礼的 
rude or impolite; having or showing a lack of respect for other people
impeccable:
没有缺点的 
free from fault or error
shrivel:
使 枯萎，干枯，皱缩 
to become or make something dry and wrinkled from heat, cold or old age
antagonist:
对手 
a person who is strongly opposed to something or someone
freight:
货运； 货运货物 
the transport of goods by truck, train, ship, or aircraft; goods transported in bulk by truck, 
train, ship, or aircraft

运送；装货 
to transport (goods) in bulk by truck, train, ship, or aircraft
recession:
经济衰退；经济萎缩 
a difficult time for the economy of a country, when there is less trade and industrial activity 
than usual and more people are unemployed 
12
conspire:
密谋；图谋；阴谋 
to secretly plan with other people to do something illegal or harmful

事件 凑在一起致使，共同导致不良后果 
(of events) to seem to work together to make something bad happen
reverberate:
回响 
to continue in a series of quickly repeated sounds that bounce off a surface (such as a wall)

事情、思想等产生巨大反响，引起轰动，影响深远 
to have continuing and serious effects
evade:
避免 
to stay away from (someone or something); to avoid (someone or something)

逃避 
to avoid dealing with or facing (something)
diffuse:
传播；扩散；漫射 
to pour out; to spread out; to scatter
appraise:
估值 
to say how much something is worth after you have carefully examined it; to give an 
official opinion about the value of (something)
veteran:
老兵 
someone who fought in a war as a soldier, sailor, etc.

经验丰富的人 
someone who has a lot of experience in a particular activity, job, etc.
obscure:
无名的；鲜为人知的 
not well known

费解的；难以理解的 
difficult to understand

使模糊；使隐晦；使费解 
to make it difficult to see, hear or understand something
blotch:
皮肤、植物、物体等上面不规则的斑点，污点 
a mark, usually not regular in shape, on skin, plants, material, etc.
unrelenting:
持续的；不缓和的；势头不减的 
(of an unpleasant situation) not stopping or becoming less severe

不留情面的 
(of a person or their behavior) not giving way to kindness or compassion
indifferent:
冷漠的 
not interested in or concerned about something 
13
weld:
焊接 
to join pieces of metal together by heating the edges until they begin to melt and then 
pressing them together

使结合；使成整体 
to join or bring (people or things) close together
negligible:
微不足道的；不重要的；不值一提的 
of very little importance or size and not worth considering insignificant
patriot:
爱国者 
a person who loves and strongly supports or fights for his or her country
founder:
创立者 
a person who creates or establishes something that is meant to last for a long time (such as 
a business or school); a person who founds something
tactile:
触觉的 
relating to the sense of touch
espouse:
支持 
to express support for (a cause, belief, etc.)
modulate:
调节 
to change the sound of (your voice) by making it quieter, higher, lower, etc.
benefactor:
捐助人 
someone who helps another person, group, etc., by giving money
excavate:
发掘，挖出 古建筑或古物 
to dig in the ground to look for old buildings or objects that have been buried for a long 
time; to find something by digging in this way

挖掘，开凿，挖空 洞、隧道等 
to make a hole, etc. in the ground by digging
shatter:
粉碎 
to break suddenly into many small pieces
slab:
岩石，混凝土，木质厚板 
a thick, flat piece of food (such as bread or meat)

蛋糕，面包，巧克力一大块 
a thick, flat piece of a hard material (such as stone or wood)
facilitate:
促进，使容易 
to make (something) easier; to help cause (something)
utilitarian:
实用的，功利主义 
an advocate or adherent of utilitarianism 
14
convict:
宣判 某人 有罪 
prove to be guilty

已决犯；服刑囚犯 
one who has been convicted
indict:
控告 
to formally decide that someone should be put on trial for a crime
inexorable:
不可阻挡的 
not able to be stopped or changed
quell:
平息 
to calm or reduce (something, such as fear or worry)

镇压 
to end or stop (something) usually by using force
paradigm:
范式，样板 
a model or pattern for something that may be copied
sanity:
神志正常 
the condition of having a healthy mind; the condition of being sane
